ETYMOLOGY: From Old French difference, from Latin differentia ('state of being different'), from differre (to differ, carry apart).

MEANINGS.PATTERN:
[the] difference [between sth and sth]
[a] difference [in sth]
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The quality or state of being unlike or dissimilar; a distinguishing feature.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The main difference between the two candidates is their policy on environmental protection.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 两位候选人之间的主要区别在于他们对环境保护的政策。

MEANINGS.PATTERN:
[to] make a difference
[it] doesn't make a difference
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A change or effect, usually significant or beneficial, resulting from an action.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 影响；作用；重要性（常用于 make a difference）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Even a small contribution can make a big difference to the charity.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 即使是小小的捐款，也能对慈善事业产生巨大的影响。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The result obtained when one number or quantity is subtracted from another.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 计算 450 和 320 之间的差。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: They had a minor difference over where to go for dinner.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他们在晚餐去哪里吃的问题上存在一个小小的分歧。
